briefdescription.para: Tracks whether the ADC subsystem has been properly initialized.

detaileddescription.para: This flag prevents ADC operations from being performed before the hardware has been configured. Set to true after successful completion of adc_init().

Stores the currently configured voltage reference source:
ADC_REF_VCC: Uses VCC (typically 5V) as reference
ADC_REF_INTERNAL: Uses internal 2.56V reference
ADC_REF_EXTERNAL: Uses external AREF pin voltage

briefdescription.para: ADC calibration factor for voltage accuracy correction.

detaileddescription.para: Multiplicative factor applied to raw voltage calculations to compensate for reference voltage variations and component tolerances. Default value of 1.0 assumes perfect accuracy.

briefdescription.para: Validates that an ADC channel number is within acceptable range.

simplesect.para: true if channel is valid, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Maps sonicator ID to corresponding ADC channel.

simplesect.para: ADC channel for power sensing, or ADC_CHANNEL_MAX if invalid

briefdescription.para: Initializes the ADC subsystem with default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
Configures ADC with:
VCC reference voltage (5V)
128 prescaler (16MHz/128 = 125kHz ADC clock)
Enables ADC hardware
Performs stabilization dummy conversion
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

Sets ADMUX register REFS1:0 bits to select reference:
External: REFS1=0, REFS0=0 (uses AREF pin)
VCC: REFS1=0, REFS0=1 (uses VCC as reference)
Internal: REFS1=1, REFS0=1 (uses internal 2.56V)
reference
Desired reference voltage source
ADC_OK on success, ADC_ERROR_INVALID_REF for invalid reference

inbodydescription.para: ADMUX register manipulation for external reference
Clears both REFS1 (bit 7) and REFS0 (bit 6) in ADMUX to select external AREF pin as voltage reference
ADMUX register manipulation for VCC reference
Clears REFS1 (bit 7) and sets REFS0 (bit 6) in ADMUX to select VCC as voltage reference
ADMUX register manipulation for internal reference
Sets both REFS1 (bit 7) and REFS0 (bit 6) in ADMUX to select internal 2.56V reference
Updates current reference tracking variable
Stores the newly configured reference for use in voltage conversion calculations
Reference settling delay
2ms delay allows internal reference circuits to stabilize after configuration change

briefdescription.para: Configures ADC clock prescaler for optimal conversion timing.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets ADCSRA register ADPS2:0 bits to control ADC clock frequency. ADC clock should be between 50kHz-200kHz for maximum resolution.
prescaler
Desired clock division factor
ADC_OK on success, ADC_ERROR_INVALID_REF for invalid prescaler

inbodydescription.para: ADCSRA prescaler bits manipulation
Clears ADPS2 (bit 2), ADPS1 (bit 1), and ADPS0 (bit 0) then sets the new prescaler value in these bits

briefdescription.para: Performs complete ADC conversion on specified channel.

detaileddescription.para:
Selects channel, starts conversion, waits for completion with timeout protection, and returns 10-bit result
channel
ADC input channel (0-7 for ATmega32A)
value
Pointer to store 10-bit conversion result (0-1023)
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

inbodydescription.para: ADMUX channel selection
Preserves upper 3 bits (reference and result adjustment) while setting lower 5 bits (MUX4:0) to select input channel
Conversion start trigger
Sets ADSC (ADC Start Conversion) bit in ADCSRA register to begin analog-to-digital conversion
Conversion timeout counter
Prevents infinite loop if ADC hardware fails to complete conversion within reasonable time (1000 microseconds)
Microsecond delay during polling
1Î¼s delay between ADSC bit checks to prevent excessive CPU usage while waiting for conversion completion
ADC result register reading sequence
ADCL (low byte) must be read first to trigger register locking, preventing corruption during 16-bit read operation
< ADC Data Register Low byte (bits 7:0)
< ADC Data Register High byte (bits 9:8)
10-bit result reconstruction
Combines high and low bytes into complete 10-bit value with proper bit positioning

briefdescription.para: Initiates ADC conversion without waiting for completion.

detaileddescription.para:
Non-blocking function that selects channel and starts conversion. Use adc_conversion_complete() and adc_get_result() to retrieve result.
channel
ADC input channel to convert
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

inbodydescription.para: Non-blocking channel selection
Same ADMUX manipulation as blocking version but without waiting for conversion completion
Non-blocking conversion start
Triggers conversion start but returns immediately, allowing other code to execute during conversion time

briefdescription.para: Checks if ADC conversion has completed.

detaileddescription.para: Check if ADC conversion is complete.

Non-blocking function to poll conversion status without consuming CPU cycles in busy-wait loop
complete
Pointer to store completion status (true if done)
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

inbodydescription.para: ADSC bit status check
ADSC (ADC Start Conversion) bit is automatically cleared by hardware when conversion completes. Invert logic since cleared bit indicates completion.

detaileddescription.para:
Reads ADC data registers after conversion completion. Should only be called after adc_conversion_complete() returns true.
value
Pointer to store 10-bit conversion result
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

inbodydescription.para: Conversion status verification
Ensures conversion has completed before attempting to read result registers to prevent invalid data
Atomic result register reading
Same sequence as blocking read - ADCL first to lock registers and prevent corruption
< ADC Data Register Low byte
< ADC Data Register High byte
Result value reconstruction
Combines register bytes into complete 10-bit ADC result

briefdescription.para: Converts raw ADC value to actual voltage measurement.

detaileddescription.para: Convert raw ADC value to voltage.

Applies reference voltage scaling and calibration factor to convert 10-bit ADC reading to real-world voltage value
raw_value
Raw ADC reading (0-1023)
voltage
Pointer to store calculated voltage in volts
ADC_OK on success, error code on failure

inbodydescription.para: Reference voltage determination
Selects appropriate reference voltage based on current ADC configuration for accurate voltage calculation
VCC reference voltage
Uses system-defined VCC voltage (typically 5.0V) from ADC_REFERENCE_VOLTAGE constant
Internal reference voltage
ATmega32A internal reference is precisely 2.56V as specified in datasheet

briefdescription.para: ADC Hardware Abstraction Layer Implementation for ATmega32A.
